Package com.nokia.places

The places package provides data objects used to describe a place in detail.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Address
    This interface provides textual address information for a location.
    AlternativeNames
    This interface represents alternative names for a Place.
    ApiLink
    This interface represents a Nokia Places link which requires another request to be made in order to retrieve the desired resource.
    Category
    This interface represents a category with which a Place can be associated.
    ContactDetail
    This interface represents detailed information about a contact for a Place.
    Contacts
    This interface represents all the different means of contacting a Place.
    Content
    This interface represents the basis for additional rich content about a Place.
    ContentType
    This interface defines a set of supported Place content types.
    DiscoveryContext
    This interface represents information about the context that the Place service has chosen for the query.
    ExtendedAttribute
    This interface represents additional detailed information about a Place.
    ExternalLink
    This interface represents a link to the origin of supplied information, which typically is a website of the supplier.
    Item
    This interface represents a basis for Items found in a ResultPage.
    ItemPageLink
    This interface represents a link to retrieve the next Page of Item objects.
    Location
    This interface represents the physical location of a place.
    LocationContext
    This interface defines a series of constants for methods of finding a location and is used to tie the search to a specific method of defining the location.
    Page
    This interface defines a basis for a paginated collection.
    Place
    This interface represents a set of data about a physical place.
    PlaceLink
    Represents a link containing discovery information about a Place.
    Ratings
    This interface represents a summary of the user ratings for a Place.
    ResultPage
    This interface represents the basis of a paginated collection.
    RichText
    This interface represents text in either a plain or HTML-encoded format.
    SearchContext
    This interface defines the details of the location the search was centred upon.
    Supplier
    This interface represents the information source for a Place or a place's Content.
    SupplierLink
    This interface represents a link to meta-information about a Supplier.
    User
    Represents an individual user who has reviewed a Place.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    PlaceFactory
    This class is used to instantiate the various search requests from the RESTful places web service.

Package com.nokia.places Description

The places package provides data objects used to describe a place in detail.

The basis of a places search is a ResultPageRequest This can be created using the createResultPageRequest() method of the com.nokia.maps.places.PlaceFactory, which can be accessed using PlaceFactory.getInstance(). A ResultPageRequest can be used to create various searches such as finding places in a specified Category around a specified location or places associated with a specified free text. Places searches may be either synchronous or asynchronous. The asynchronous methods take a listener as call parameter. An example synchronous search s is demonstrated by the short code example below:

PlaceFactory placeFactory = PlaceFactory.getInstance();
ResultPageRequest placesSearchRequest = placeFactory.createResultPageRequest();
GeoCoordinate BERLIN = new GeoCoordinate(52.500556, 13.398889, 0);
placesSearchRequest.explore("restaurant", BERLIN)

Once a ResultPage of PlaceLink items has been retrieved, it is possible to obtain more information about a place through using its id.

PlaceFactory placeFactory = PlaceFactory.getInstance();
GeocodeRequest placeDetailsRequest = placeFactory.createPlaceRequest();
Place place = placeDetailsRequest.getPlace(placeId );

Note that searches can be run in a different thread by calling the method that contains the corresponding listener.

  • For the ResultPageRequest the corresponding listener is the ResultPageRequestListener ResultPageRequestListener
  • For the PlaceRequest the corresponding listener is the PlaceRequestListener PlaceRequestListener
